Articles.Content:
Do you use the ZO2 main system on your ship?

It should regenerate ZO2 while active (=green background).
i haven\'t use ZO2 system. can you please put some links where to download the ZO2 system compatible to 0.14.4? thank you.

I can ;D

[http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=9763.0](http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=9763.0)

Hey Kreuzung,

I like these things relly much!!

WhatÂ´s the progress of the MultiJoint Parts?
Didn\'t work for days on it, maybe I\'ll have time for some simple things and making a new concept today, plans are rather complicatednow.

Someone tried this with the newest MuMech version and .15?

Don\'t have the time to fix it, maybe at the weekend, if school work allows it.

Running into issues with the new plugin loader. Since you were the only other person I knew of who extended one plugin with another, I was going to ask you if it was throwing a fit with your plugin also.

Tried out Plugin only+VB parts and it said that the parts aren\'t aviable. Gonna try it with the new MJ version and recompiling, don\'t have too much hope that it will work.

Edit: Crap. Didn\'t work. And I\'ve got no time for this now...

Tried a pure plugin reference plugin ... plugin set, and that did load and play correctly, so it\'s not the new plugin loader that\'s the problem. Going to have to get dirty now and dig into MuMechLib. I\'ll let you know when I get it working.

Problem solved, add a \'Z\' to the beginning of your plugin name.

 See last post here for underlying problem:

[http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=12393.0](http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=12393.0)

Yes, that seems to work, thanks. Added it to the Xenolith description.

However, I\'m gonna re-write it using the new resource system.
has anyone got the void buccaneering parts to work in 0.15? i just have grey textures and are unclickable?
Rename the plugin so that it is behind MuMechLib in alphabetical order. Also, panels don\'t seem to work. And I really hate .15 for it\'s terrain improvemets, game is unplayable now.

> 
> Rename the plugin so that it is behind MuMechLib in alphabetical order. Also, panels don\'t seem to work. And I really hate .15 for it\'s terrain improvemets, game is unplayable now.

done this file is named z-Kreuzung ... might be an issue with osx not handing over the files in alpha order

I have terrible framerate with .15 also, but we found something of a workaround.

> 
> 

Just ignore the pony, and give it a try.

 Have you actually found anything on the resource system? I haven\'t actually seen anything of it.

I\'m working on a new interface for my panels, so that it will be easy to make derived classes for working with other plugins. 

I read your ideas about heat management, so the panels will give 3 values that can be used in derived classes: efficiency (for power output with all the panel logic), front side exposion and back side exposion (with no cap).

I\'ll also make a switch that changes the rotation logic to radiator - minimize the exposion.

kellven, found that on IRC yesterday, it works for me, and I can also fly planes with the ocean 2m too low ;P

Alchemist, that\'s cool, I really like that, finally animated and realistic working panels.
Hey Kreuzung have you something working at the moment ?

Yes. Schoolwork ;P

Tried around yesterday, think I know what I did wrong...

I fixed the solar panels now, don\'t feel like packing dll and source now though.

Edit: Packed & uploaded...
Extremely noobie question. Where do i put the source folder when i download the plugin?

You can ignore the source folder, it\'s not needed to use the plugin. It\'s the source code to the plugin in case you want to look at it.

Cheers!

Capt\'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager
Could you update MechJeb in your zip? The one from their thread seemed to have one or two options more, but it doesn\'t work with your plugin.

Made a compatibility plugin that allow using my panels with MuMech tanks. Just install it (+ both PowerTech.dll and MuMechLib.dll), take any PowerTech-compatible panels and change couple strings in the part.cfg.

For more info see the PowerTech plugin thread: [http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=9533](http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=9533)
The plugin loader doesn\'t take into account referenced plugins atm. Result is I have to recompile my plugins every time MechJeb updates. You probably have the same problem.
